reviews.text: Very pretty bridge but packed with tourists of course. You can get tickets up the street for a number of attractions which is very reasonably priced... there are cute cafes and restaurants on the other side of the bridge, worth.exploring some of the ancient houses and chapels in the surrounding area

Steeped in history. Attracts huge crowds. That's a little forbidding though.  The street that leads beyond the bridge is quaint and not to be missed. Am told it comes alive late evening with colourful lanterns  lighting up the place beautifully.

Parking scams, be prepared

Be extremely careful when you park a motorbike. There's NO sign saying that you can or cannot park inside the town. Apparently, there are some speakers telling you what you can do or not but we didn't hear anything. We saw 2 guys escorting our motorbike on a bicycle (yes), stopped them and got the scooter back without paying anything. We saw some other guys bringing another scooter on a small street and locking the scooter to another one. I guess they'll ask you some money if you want your motorbike back (well, if you find it, it's not where you parked).
Second, once we got the bike back, we tried to park on a scooter parking. A woman asked for 10k (it was written : Price 5000d on the sign), she didn't want us to park there once we saw the price and took some pictures of the sign. We left, found another parking. The price on the sign was covered with some tape but on one side only, other side was well hidden, saying 5k. We gave 5k to the guy who looked surprised. 
My point is : Yes, 10k is it only what... 0,4 USD. But it's the double that the actual price, keep than in mind and don't feed these tourist scams.
Interesting wooden bridge built over a 3 year period, couldn't find any nail. Still in good shape. Worth a visit.

The most visited attraction at Hoi An. The bridge cut across popular tourist attraction. You are likely to cross the bridge a few times.
There is a fees to cross the bridge.
There are stone statue of dogs and monkey inside the bridge. and expect to be crowded at all times.
Taking photos further down the river with the bridge is nice.
Night time at the river will be beautiful view with all the lantern light up.

The place is nice, has some history but plenty of the information is only in Vietnamese. We had the audio guide and it makes it more appealing but the museum itself is only to have a rough idea of the history and traditions... the place is WARM! So don’t go there thinking you’ll escape the heat from the street
Very small museum but wonderful exhibitions. Also the current photography exhibition there is lovely. View from the top is beautiful!
One of many museums. Not that exciting but a great place to have a view over the town.
Get yourself an Audio tour machine which is much easier to travel around in the old town. The Audio will tell you all stories and history

It was ok. The view from the top was nice. It's pretty close to the queen of bahn mi shop. We went here as one of our 5 stops in Hoi an. As far as museums go, it's pretty small, but it's worth a visit once.
A nice place
only one strong point is the view of second floor.

This museum displays artifacts from Sa Huynh culture - one that was native to Hoi An and surrounding regions between 2 BC to 2 AD centuries (predating the Champa civilization). Most impressive are the terracotta vase coffins. Really worth a visit.
I don't regret using one of my tickets for this
The museum is worth using ticket

Lovely old Hoi An house to visit. You can get a ticket for 120kVND and visit 5 sites out of a selection of 22 in the area. It's worth it and gives you a purpose for walking around and it helps maintaining the historical sites.
Interesting house and furniture, but not very big... Included in old town ticket though, so if you don't use your other entries for something else, it's worth taking a look.
Best of the ancient houses (the others were too busy and/or just a facade for a shop).
Nice with good historical facts but not very impressive nor interesting.
Very nice. Old. Worthy.
Just beautiful. Even if you've seen many you'll still find something unique here
Beautiful and colorful place. Dragon everywhere! Stop by!
A very touristic place with amazing walls and statues.
My favourite of the historical Hoi An attractions. Could be because of its fantastical dragon statues, both, at the back and front but I loved the massive mural at the back of the compound.

If you're Chinese or Hongkongese, or you're interested in architect or photography, or you have a tour guide, this place is good. Otherwise sightseeing here is just a waste of time and money since you've seen enough of the asian religious places architect.

Not sure why this has so few reviews and does not show up properly on Google maps. Maybe there is a more popular entry under slightly different name. Anyway I really enjoyed this assembly hall. Others seemed unimpressed by small size but as my wife always reassures me, it's what you do with it that really matters. This is a meeting place and not exclusively a place of worship, but some of the craftsmanship is truly worthy of the best temples.

If you enjoy looking at something like an intricate carved panel or screen and wonder how much time and skill is involved, then I recommend this place to you. I put up some pictures as words are a poor substitute. It's a quick visit. Do it instead of shopping for ethnic tat you just don't need. Feed your creative soul!
b

Hội quán Triều Châu hay còn gọi là chùa Âm Bổn, tọa lạc tại 157 Nguyễn Duy Hiệu. Hội quán Triều Châu được Hoa kiều bang Triều Châu xây dựng vào năm 1845 làm nơi sinh hoạt cộng đồng và tín ngưỡng riêng của người Triều Châu ở Hội An. Hội quán thờ các vị thần chế ngự sóng gió, qua đó cầu mong việc đi lại buôn bán trên biển được thuận buồm, xuôi gió. Hội quán là một công trình kiến trúc với bộ khung gỗ chạm trổ tinh xảo, cùng những họa tiết, trang trí bằng gỗ theo các truyền thuyết dân gian và những tác phẩm đắp nổi bằng sành sứ tuyệt đẹp.
建立與新年1776年，是潮州人所建立的，在光緒年間有經歷過一次重建，屋頂有很精緻的雕刻雙是手工比起其他的會館更顯的驚喜，藝專以往都是從潮州運過來在建造的
Очень маленький храм. Но красивый

This should be the no.1 place to eat on trip advisor in Hoi An. BEST food we've tried so far in Vietnam!! So glad our hotel recommended this place. Fantastic authentic Vietnamese food. Really decent portions with around several different dishes on the set menu (£4 for the lot!). The whole experience was wicked, from the waitress greeting us to showing us how to put the dishes together. Would highly recommend!

Oh man. What else can I say about this place but GO NOW !! 

Look if you’re not down with eating authentic food on the streets / or in there “dining room” - then this isn’t the spot for you. But bang for your buck - overall taste and friendliness of the staff and owners. This place is a gem and for my money is a must for any Hoi An visitor. Just over 200.000 dong for too much food with a couple beers. Great spot
Great dinner experience, fixed menu. Hostess shows you how to put together your meal, roll it all in rice paper and dip it. Great meal for $7.50 US. Will return before we leave town.

I was really nice place to enjoy satay, spring rolls. banseo. etc. 
I truly recommend this restaurant for family group including children.

WOOWWW so delicious! All my friends ordered the banquet, however, as a vegan I was fearful that I'd go hungry... until the staff kindly prepared me a separate VEGAN banquet! It was absolutely delicious and cost only 100,000 vnd.  
Great atmosphere. 
Friends loved their food too!

Totally honest opinion, I own 2 restaurant's in Europe, The food is great really clean solid flavours the vibe has a shabby chic family style and to food can go to the western side or Vietnamese. It's really underestimated and totally affordable and not false reviews that some of the other restaurant's have around the area! Good for vegans or #vegetarian too.
Lovely cafe with great food. Had the crispy pancakes and was shown how to roll them etc - very authentic!
Beefsoup and fishsoup and a dish with no name (show him the foto) super good food and two large beer....€11,30 The best in Ho An!
Excellent great food. Brilliant place to peoplecwatch and taste the atmosphere of nightime Hoi An
WoW! Juste WoW! We try many different dishes and everything was tasty!

Nice atmosphere and good food. Staff was polite and gave us plenty of time to decide what we want. I had Mango salad for starter and Sea bass cooked in banana leaf for main. Very tasty food. My family ordered Yellow curry and Fish in a clay pot. Everybody was satisfied. Coconut cake was a bit more like bread and butter pudding, a bit stodgy but not too sweet.
Excellent display of food.  Really liked the egg roll and Phoenix display.  Taco and dessert were very unique as well.  One of my favorite  during my tour.
Prices are high but food quality is good and it is a comfortable dining environment. Recommended if you are looking for something different than a typical local restaurant.
I thoroughly enjoyed the prawns in spicy soup. And other members of our party had equally delicious meals.

Prices not reasonable for food/service quality. 
The Restaurant and terrace itself is quite nice.

My favourite restaurant in the area. The food is very fresh and the atmosphere is so peaceful...away from the honking traffic in a nice garden setting. 
Local Vietnamese food at fair prices for the style of restaurant... two people, ordered 4 dishes + beer for around 400K.
Open for lunch and dinner.
They have an amazing set menu for groups of 4 or more (see photo).

Lovely restaurant with an extensive menu with plenty of local dishes to try. Slightly more expensive than many of the restaurants in town but this is really lovely date spot. Best white rose dumplings of anywhere we’ve try them in town. Clay pot fish was great too!

Kudos to the chef, good food, affordable prices and friendly service... what else is needed? For sure try this one to get away from the high touristic prices! We had wontons, white roses and rice pancakes, all of them highly recommended!

We discovered this restaurant on Google's recommendation and were weren't disappointed. It's worth going to, out of the village, either a short walk or a cheap cab ride. The food is amazing. All recipes care of the matriarch of the family. Restaurant is owned by the son but managed by the daughter. She was so lovely and welcoming. Really great traditional food. So worth visiting.

Good place to have some Vietnam food. 
Very nice local restaurant and good quality of food. All things are great!

The food was good - we had fried spring rolls and noodles with chicken. However, food is all that is good. Staff is not really friendly, they even asked a guest sitting next to us leave because he was using their power to charge the laptop and their wifi (which was not even working).

I had very decent Cao Lau Noodles and a coke for 60k ($2,50) with a view on the river and a nice, clean atmosphere! Owner was friendly! I don’t understand the previous bad reviews! Maybe the owner changed? There is a fixed menu with very good prices (restaurants next door charge 3-4x the amount).
I enjoyed my meal!

The grilled eggplant with pork was alright. The pork can be a bit hard sometimes but the eggplant topping was tasty. The service was quite poor though as the lady rushes us to order and had an “angry” face most of the time

Cocktails are really bad. They use the cheapest booze imaginable and fairly sure every one uses sparkling water and a spoonful of sugar, regardless of what you order.

Food is decent, but not worth the prices at all. Anything soupy is bland, even by European standards.

Kitchen looks clean, seating is comfortable, staff speaks acceptable English and is friendly.
Very good Bahn mis!! Don’t understand the bad reviews but also didn’t try anything else cause the Bahn mis we’re awesome. Also we drunk mojitos, not the best, but enjoyable.
We enjoyed the ambience and the good food. Service was great! Four stars only because the fresh beer wasn’t so good.
These people "run out of fresh beer" when they decide that they're done serving you. It happened to us twice. Nice service guys, nice service (please note sarcasm).
Food was too oily even for oily Vietnamese food. Banana juice was good. Mango juice was just ok.
Good food and service, nice location.

The food really isn't good. The duck was very dry, the pasta carbonara sweet and just not tasty. Finished after a few bites unfortunately.
And the atmosphere wasn't great either..

Food was good but staff at night had difficulty with English.  I ended up with 2 large meals!! We were with 6 others Hungry men so not a problem. Great stop I recommend but caution in communication use translator app!!! I didnt!!!!

There are many beautiful white lenterns in front of main gate and also inside too.

Personally, I like 2nd floor.

There is a great view in the night time.

They sell a BS31 ice cream on the 1st floot left side.
Very expensive, terrible food. Avoid unless you like getting ripped off. Super touristy. Can't believe it has a 3.9 rating

A very nice restaurant for an evening meal on the upstairs balcony while watching people go by on the street below. The food here is very good and flavourful. Had the grilled squid in 5 spices, grilled prawns, sauted morning glory, grilled duck and crispy seafood noodles. The service is pretty good....food arrived in around 20 mins. The server was attentive but her english was not that good....but she tried hard and it wasnt a problem at all. Try the iced lotus tea here.....recomended. A good experience altogether but this place is moderately pricey. The food was worth it though.
Thwy have ao dai here for rent. Walk to the back of the ground floor to choose from a large variety and enquire with the staff

I was here for lunch with my family 
We ordered chicken fried rice and few drinks the quality and quantity was great the price was bit up but the look and feel of the hotel was great 

The staff is helpful and are ready to serve you
Lots of vegetarian options. Fried tofu with chili and lemongrass was awesome! Good veggie burger (soft patty) and crispy fries. Veggie noodle soup was okay. Very friendly staff and owner.
This restaurant in my option is the best one in Hoi An the food is first class,and is spotlessly clean cannot fault it at all,just had an amazing meal there will be back there tomorrow night
Most enjoyable evening in this lovely restaurant.. great food happy attentive staff and all proceeds go to humanitarian aid in indochina ..

We did the cooking tour as a group of 7 and had a really good time! We chose three dishes from a set menu, then went to the market to collect our fresh ingredients. The food was really nice and the staff were great! And all the proceeds go to a charitable organisation which is really cool.

Good cooking class, trip through the market to buy ingredients was fun, nice to have a guide to answer questions. Didn't get to make individual meals, shared use of one two burner stove but the food tasted good at the end.
Only had a beer here. A bit unattending service, but I got the beer eventually. Nothing to say about it really. The view is great and good for people watching and relaxing in the shadows.
Staffs(look like owners) r horrible. They didnt let us leave before we order at least one thing. they were threatened. gees. cant believe it.

Saw about 4 rats and 2 roaches upstairs. 

Staff was very rude with the exception of one young female waitress that I wish I got the name of to at least acknowledge her. 

Pasta was not homemade. It was from a box. That wouldn't have bothered me so much, but the sauce was practically oil, and in addition to the overall pest problem and bad service, it was just an absolutely terrible experience.

I read some other reviews after the fact on both Trip Advisor and Google Maps and there are many accusations of sexual harrassment. Wow. 

Please don't make the same mistake I did by going here.
The staff here are so lovely and friendly, all speak English to a good level! Food is value for money! Food is also really good! Great portion sizes too!
I am a pizza lover and I recommend one must have at least one meal here .

The best food we have had in Vietnam so far, lovely boat ride, friendly and helpful, I think we will have no trouble making these dishes at home. Na is an amazing chef. I would go again tomorrow but have already eaten enough for two days!

We found out about this cooking class while walking through the Hoi An town. You get to choose 3 things  from a menu that you'd like to cook. The lesson starts with a trip to the market to buy the key ingredients like meat, vegetables, etc. Then a boat ride to the riverside cooking school. The classes are kept small. We had an amazing time cooking with the 2 ladies and would highly recommend it. Great way to learn some good Vietnamese dishes.

Fantastic experience here.  We're a family of 6 with kids from 9 - 14. Experience started with a tour around the market in Hoi An old town, then a 20 min boat ride to the cooking school where we cooked 3 dishes.   Very clean and hygienic and everyone got to help prepare the food. One of our very favourite experiences in Hoi An - highly recommended.

My wife and I found this place by accident whilst cycling during the day,
The lady who runs the cookery school offered to cook for us that night, so we returned and she cooked a super meal for just the 2 of us, along with cookery tips and recipes.
One of the best nights of our holiday
Great food! Extremely fresh and cooked with love. The spring rolls and ban xeo are a must try!

Friendly owner great food valuable prices. Awesome. went there again. But be careful when you see the pic of the food, It might be different. We saw the picture of chicken wings but she gave us fried minced boneless chicken so we told her it's not but she said it's the same. It wasn't the same tho. .

Don’t go here if you’re really hungry. Over cooked / old or recooked chips and had to WAIT AGES for food 30/40 mins) Then, it came out 1 main and then 1 main ages later (might as well gone and eaten separately without partner). Lovely people and place and other food fine but need to bring out mains at same time and do fresh potato.

This place become our hangout spot near our hotel. Good food - reasonable prices. Bottle of dalat Red 130k.
Friendly owners - they were cooking for us even when it was TET holiday and the family was having celebration dinner so essentially they were closed.
Recommended if your in the area.

This place is good. Very much worth the money and if you’re on the east side it’s worth trying if you’ve been around for a while and want some place new to go without overspending.

We had the shrimp fried spring rolls, the banh xeo, and the fish in clay pot. The fish was particularly good with a good serving of turmeric. 

Not a must have, but definitely a good meal.
Great food at super prices. Eggplant Claypot was especially good. Go for the large bottled local beers. Dinner for a family of 4 including 3 beers for under 10$

Absolutely delightful place. I’ve been here about five times now and all the foods and drinks I had was just perfect. Staffs and their service management is very efficient (I like how they take the menu). Tonight I had a pleasure of being serviced by a really smiley and attentive staff which was great- and made me want to leave this review. Highly recommend this place!

The food is delicious. The French toast is my favorite but they also have amazing sandwiches and desserts. The service can be a little slow, but friendly and helpful. The vibe is very chill and there's lots of room with comfortable seating.

Excellent breakfasts !!  As we got tired of breakfast noodles we slip in here and eat our fill of fantastic french toast..  Plus some days you just need that giant cup of great coffee.  The atmosphere is casual and comfortable, and the owner is warm and friendly.  We also pick up certain groceries here that we have had difficulty sourcing elsewhere.  Recommended.

Very good selection of breakfast options.
The food is very good. The service is impeccable and fast. Perfect place for lunch and dinner as well. Good location and enjoyable surrounding. Great place to enjoy a nice cold beer with friends. A good selection of brew. Perfect place. The owner Gordon is a very  nice and cordial fellow. Tumbs up...

Dingo deli is definitely a great place for tourists and locals alike to hang out.. the WiFi is the best I've used in Vietnam, plenty of quiet spaces to do some work and if you are missing some home comforts this place has everything! From Swiss cheese to baked beans and wine! 

The staff are very helpful, friendly and happy to provide anything you need!

Highly recommend this place! 10/10.
Great upstairs space. Fun cocktails, I got the jungle Jane and it was great! We stumbled in at happy hour and cocktails were half off. Salad we had was really tasty and creative.
Great local food for great value. The staff are also amazing. This place is right next to the night markets too so you can explore after you eat dinner

We stumbled on this place for dinner. The staff is very kind and speak English very well. They offered us a small portion of nachos and tempura pumpkin for free. We ordered 3 dishes including tempura shrimp and calamari. To be honest, it’s not really tempura, more like a deep fried. Still, the food is tasty.

Amazing drinks with great view of the river on the top floor. A little pricey compared to other places, but definately worth a visit. Tasty treats on the menu, we only had the calamari but it was absolutely wonderful.
Nice views, only got a beer here. But service was a bit unattending. Happy hour to 7pm which means a 450ml Saigon beer for 25k, otherwise 50k.

Despite visiting during peak hours (10am on a Sunday) my partner and I were seated immediately. Granted, we weren't picky about sitting by the door. The service was really speedy and our food came quickly. Everything was delicious.
Love this place! I miss living in the Eugene/ Springfield area since this was one of the best inexpensive restaurants around. The breakfast is amazing. Great service too!

The food is amazingly delicious. A perfect balance of vegan and non vegan options; EVERYONE can find something on the menu that they'll love. The place is very popular; there's usually a wait. We had to wait almost 40 minutes but it was totally worth it. Two different waitresses helped us and a third checked us out. All three were lovely. Can't wait to go back.

I have been a loyal customer for 4 yrs and always feel good after eating here. Good healthy food and good service. I will say that my Claire Bear potato shell had been burnt beyond edible twice but has been dealt with in full both times with replacement and still remains my favorite.
I love morning glory 🌞💫💕it's some of the best breakfast yummys I have ever had. And the staff is super friendly and awesome as well. 🌟

A great fun experience. Combining the markets, boat cruise to the restaurant, herb garden and the actual cooking lessons. Everything is prepared and ready t go. No chance of ruining it. And at the end you get to eat it. Friendly, attentive staff and attractive clean location.

A trip highlight! A fantastic day of seeing the markets, boat ride, then the delicious food. 
For nut allergy sufferers: staff were very allergy-aware and made sure my husband got to experience all the food on offer :)

We did the 1.5hr cooking school experience and had a wonderful time!  We have done the 1/2 day schools with the market tours, etc, but we really just wanted a lovely restaurant experience with demonstrations and tasting and a bit of prepping.  We got it here.  It was delicious and very filling!  Our chef was funny and kept the pace going perfectly.  Highly recommended.

Excellent visit. There was a welcome drink, tour around the market with a guide, a boat trip to the cooking school, visit to the garden and a clear and informative lesson by a very entertaining and skilled cook. Lunch was of course very tasty!

Very interesting visit to the Hoi An market, where you learn a lot about regional seafood, vegetables, rice noodles, knifes and spices. The boat trip to the cooking school is also quite nice and relaxed. The school is located outside the city in a beautiful spot by the river. The cooking lesson is very good and they provide recipes with every dish you make, so you can try again at home. All dishes were very tasty and typical Vietnamese cuisine.

Great food. Pork belly was deliciously smokey. The Banh Beo was very flavorful.

Excellent service. Will definitely come again!

Food was exceptional and so was the service - we've been travelling SE-Asia for 5 weeks with lots to compare to. I had the duck, which was incredible. Price was very reasonable for what we got, and still a third of what I'd pay for a decent meal in Canada. Slam dunk!
We have been to Hoi An 3 times now. This is the best restaurant in the city. Tan is the best host and very friendly. Get the pork belly!
One of the very best restaurants I know in Hoi An. I love my lunch and dinner there! Well recommended by me!

This restaurant was recommended to us  and it was wonderful. It is opposite the river and I love the look of this restaurant.  The service was personal and excellent, they also do cooking classes which we didn't do due to time, but hopefully will in the future.  The food was delicious, we first tried  the vegetable/plant dish morning glory in garlic and butter to go with our mains here and it was lovely, my Husband loved their fish in Banana leaf.
Only had the banana pancake and some drinks, but it was good and a great location in the center of old town for people watching.

Great place to eat! Very good service and location. Food was faboulous!!   So a question to the workers there. Who was this lovely waitress who bring me there 😀. She was so nice and would love to know her better. I think about her all the time 😊

Not really recommended, the wanton noodle only had one wanton with super minimal filling, it’s basically just dough skin. We also ordered Fried morning glory and spring rolls. Spring rolls were alright, but I was disappointed the fried morning glory was actually green vege and not the morning glory flower, maybe it’s just my ignorance.
Lovely place for some coffee and food. The decor of the place is a highlight. The mango salad and coconut coffee was amazing.
Nice place, nice food and nice staff. Honey, lemon and ginger smoothie is very nice as well :))
THIS IS NOT KARMA WATERS WRONG ADDRESS DONT SPEND MONEY GOING HERE
ngon, sạch sẽ, phục vụ nhiệt tình, thân thiện
